@description.name: @description
@description.body: A Transport is an object that can send and receive arbitrary JSON objects to a remote target using an endpoint object that does the actual communication with the target. It can be used by one or more channels.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whenever a endpoint sends a message over this transport, this event is fired with the message object as data.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: An optional human-readable name of the endpoint for use in logging, debugging etc.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The status of the endpoint, any of {@link qx.io.channel.Channel}'s CHANNELSTATUS* static constants

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property endpoint. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #endpoint}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property endpoint. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #endpoint}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property endpoint. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #endpoint}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property endpointName. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #endpointName}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property endpointName. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #endpointName}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property endpointName. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #endpointName}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property status. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #status}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property status. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #status}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property status. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #status}.
